author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Of Burberry's staunch advance and might,
In two and twenty winters' turn,
Foreseen the gain, the golden light,
In faith of fates, the numbers spurn.

In Siemens's realm of second fame,
The healthineer a weakness born,
Yet order, gold and winds of claim,
Shall lift the price, ere break of morn.

Alas, the metals' slip concerns,
Midst hope of debt's vast ceiling bound,
As Eastern gales withdraw returns,
And ebon clouds of doubt resound.

feedItems.title: Burberry Backs Outlook After 2023 Improvement
feedItems.description: Burberry reported above-forecast earnings for fiscal 2023, and said that despite the uncertain environment, it was confident of meeting its 2024 and medium-term targets.

feedItems.title: Siemens's 2Q Profitability Hit by Weak Healthineers
feedItems.description: Siemens’s overall second-quarter results exceeded expectations on orders, revenue and cash flow, AlphaValue said, adding that its forecasts should go up, with an expected increase in its target price.

feedItems.title: Metals Slip Despite US Debt Ceiling Hopes as Chinese Demand Worries Return
feedItems.description: Base and precious metals prices moved lower as worries over Chinese demand returned to the fore following Wednesday’s rally on hopes that an agreement over the U.S. debt ceiling would be reached.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of oil, that blackest brew, we sing,
From earth's depths, by demons wrung,
Its price doth fall, a fickle thing,
No ear to EIA's dirge hath clung.

The dollar, proud and gleaming bright,
On eagle's wings finds strength anew,
Debt ceiling fears dissolve in night,
As whispers of a deal's breakthrough.

Now caution, friends, o'er Greek bonds keep,
Elections near, the fates unknown,
Yet if New Democracy long sleeps,
Investment's grade might call them home.

feedItems.title: Crude Oil Softens After Wednesday's Rally
feedItems.description: Crude oil prices edged lower having rallied on Wednesday, with ING Think saying the market continued to be driven by external developments, rather than fundamentals, having ignored a largely bearish EIA inventory report.

feedItems.title: Dollar Rises as Debt Ceiling Worries Ease, Rate-Cut Bets Are Trimmed
feedItems.description: The dollar has continued to rise as comments from U.S. politicians increase optimism that a deal on raising the debt ceiling will be reached, boosting appetite for risk and in turn reducing bets on future Fed rate cuts, MUFG said.

feedItems.title: Caution Over Greek Bonds Seen Warranted Ahead of Elections
feedItems.description: Caution over Greek government bonds ahead of Greece’s elections on Sunday is warranted, Citi said, adding that a return of the incumbent New Democracy with a workable majority would be instrumental in getting to an investment grade rating which could then open the door to an inclusion of GGBs in IG indices.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Of banks and coin, I sing today,
In lands far off, the doves at play,
In Philippines, their rates stand still,
As inflation slows o'er vale and hill.

A song of wings in yonder skies,
The EasyJet with fortune flies,
Interim losses less lament,
With sales like goats, they surge, ascent.

Now tale of wires, that bind us near,
To BT's trumpet, lend your ear,
The fourth, a bower of gains and hope,
On pro forma growth, the snails elope.

feedItems.title: Philippines Central Bank Keeps Rate Steady as Inflation Slows
feedItems.description: Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged, as expected in a Wall Street Journal poll.

feedItems.title: EasyJet Cuts Losses as Sales Surge
feedItems.description: EasyJet interim losses narrowed as sales rose 80% on strong demand, and said it expected to deliver its medium-term targets sooner.

feedItems.title: BT Sees Growth as Fourth Quarter Tops Hopes
feedItems.description: BT reported an above-consensus 10% rise in adjusted profits in the fourth quarter and said it expected revenue and earnings growth in the year ahead, on a pro forma basis

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In realm of emerald hue and eastern sun,
Micron, the skilled, with Tokyo entwined,
Investing sums both vast and hard-earned won,
In tensions of the courts, celestial bind.

As giants of oil retreat from lands afar,
Young warriors bold in quest for treasures old,
Energies bound in ancient Earth's memoir,
In BP, Chevron, and Total's shadow, unfold.

Upon the icy shores of Northern isle,
Bitcoin miner, Bit Digital, in dance,
Prepares for tides of future tax's guile,
With twinkling coin, they forge ahead and prance.

feedItems.title: Micron Outlines $3.6 Billion Investment With Japan's Backing
feedItems.description: The U.S. chip maker’s deal with Tokyo comes at a time of rising tension between Washington and Beijing over chip technology.

feedItems.title: As Oil Giants Retreat Globally, Smaller Players Rush In
feedItems.description: Energy companies such as BP, TotalEnergies and Chevron are shifting to cleaner projects, creating an opening for independent and private companies to buy up their operations or push ahead with exploration.

feedItems.title: Bitcoin Miner Bit Digital Adds Machines in Iceland Before Possible U.S. Tax Crackdown
feedItems.description: The Biden administration is seeking to impose a big levy on crypto miners.
